Package eu.iv4xr.japyre.connection

Class ObjectReaderWriter_OverSocket

java.lang.Object
eu.iv4xr.japyre.connection.ObjectReaderWriter_OverSocket
public class ObjectReaderWriter_OverSocket extends Object
Provide a convenient reader/writer to read and write objects over a socket. This allows an object to be send over the socket (to a recipient on the other side of the socket-connection), encoded as a Json-string. Similarly, the reader can receive an object, encoded as a Json-string, that was sent to this class over the socket. Note that this implies that the object sent like this must be serializable to Json.

This class can be used by both a server or a client.

Note: this class was taken over from iv4xrDemo.

  • Method Details

    • write

      public void write​(Object packageToSend)
      Send an object to the host. The object will first be serialized to a json string, so it is assumed that the json serializer knows how to handle the object.

    • read

      public <T> T read​(Class<T> expectedClassOfResultObj) throws IOException
      Read an object that was sent by the host. The object will be received as a json string, which is then converted into an instance of the given class. It is assumed that the json deserializer knows how to do this. The resulting object is then returned.
      Throws:
      IOException

    • close

      public void close() throws IOException
      Close the reader/writer. This does NOT close the socket.
      Throws:
      IOException
